alert.note: Alert for Northern Clearwater Mountains; Orofino, Grangeville Region; Southern Clearwater Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 5:27PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Idaho and central Clearwater Counties through 515 PM PDT... At 426 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lowell, or 25 miles east of Kamiah, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Idaho and central Clearwater Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Northern Clearwater Mountains; Orofino, Grangeville Region; Southern Clearwater Mountains
